events.originalText: Some of the closest advisors and collaborators of Czech Prime Minister Petr Nečas were arrested for corruption.
events.subtitle: Petr Nečas
events.headline: Close advisors of Czech Prime Minister Petr Nečas arrested for corruption

events.originalText: A 6.0 Mw earthquake caused up to NZ$6 billion of additional damage to Christchurch, New Zealand, which was still recovering from an earthquake four months earlier.
events.subtitle: June 2011 Christchurch earthquake
events.headline: 6.0 Mw earthquake causes NZ$6 billion damage to Christchurch, New Zealand

events.originalText: Insurgents carried out a second bombing at the al-Askari Mosque, one of the holiest sites in Shia Islam.
events.subtitle: 2007 al-Askari mosque bombing
events.headline: Second bombing at al-Askari Mosque, a holy site in Shia Islam

events.originalText: After an 81-day standoff sparked by their refusal to be evicted from their foreclosed property in Jordan, Montana, the Christian Patriot group Montana Freemen surrendered to the FBI.
events.subtitle: Foreclosure
events.headline: Christian Patriot group Montana Freemen surrender after 81-day standoff in Jordan, Montana

events.originalText: Pioneer 10 passed the orbit of Neptune, becoming the first man-made object to leave the proximity of the major planets of the Solar System.
events.subtitle: Pioneer 10
events.headline: Pioneer 10 becomes first man-made object to leave major planets of Solar System

events.originalText: English teenager Marcus Sarjeant fired six blanks at Queen Elizabeth II as she rode down The Mall to the Trooping the Colour ceremony.
events.subtitle: Marcus Sarjeant
events.headline: Teenager fires blanks at Queen Elizabeth II during Trooping the Colour ceremony

events.originalText: The New York Times published the first excerpts from the Pentagon Papers, a 7,000-page classified Department of Defense history of the United States' political and military involvement in the Vietnam War.
events.subtitle: The New York Times
events.headline: New York Times publishes excerpts from Pentagon Papers on Vietnam War

events.originalText: "The Long and Winding Road" became the Beatles' twentieth and final number-one single on the Billboard Hot 100 chart.
events.subtitle: The Long and Winding Road
events.headline: Beatles' 'The Long and Winding Road' tops Billboard Hot 100 chart

events.originalText: Governor of Texas Preston Smith signed a law converting a research arm of Texas Instruments into the University of Texas at Dallas.
events.subtitle: Preston Smith (governor)
events.headline: Governor Preston Smith signs law converting Texas Instruments research arm into University of Texas at Dallas

events.originalText: Soviet aircraft shot down a Swedish military plane carrying out signals-intelligence gathering operations, followed three days later by the shootdown of a second plane searching for the first one.
events.subtitle: Catalina affair
events.headline: Soviet aircraft shoot down Swedish military planes in signals-intelligence operations

events.originalText: Second World War: At the Battle of Villers-Bocage, German tank commander Michael Wittmann destroyed around 30 Allied vehicles in less than 15 minutes.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: German tank commander destroys 30 Allied vehicles in 15 minutes at Battle of Villers-Bocage

events.originalText: In one of the biggest upsets in championship boxing, the underdog James J. Braddock defeated Max Baer to become the heavyweight champion of the world.
events.subtitle: Boxing
events.headline: James J. Braddock upsets Max Baer to become heavyweight champion

events.originalText: World War I: The Battle of Mont Sorrel in the Ypres Salient came to an end as a Canadian assault led German forces to withdraw to their original lines.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Battle of Mont Sorrel ends with Canadian assault forcing German withdrawal

events.originalText: The Jeannette expedition to reach the North Pole from the Pacific Ocean via the Bering Strait came to an end when the USS Jeannette (pictured) was finally crushed and sank after having been trapped in ice for almost two years.
events.subtitle: Jeannette expedition
events.headline: Jeannette expedition ends as USS Jeannette sinks after being trapped in ice

events.originalText: Lewis and Clark Expedition: Meriwether Lewis became the first white American to sight the Great Falls of the Missouri River.
events.subtitle: Lewis and Clark Expedition
events.headline: Meriwether Lewis sights Great Falls of Missouri River during Lewis and Clark Expedition

events.originalText: Martin Luther married Katharina von Bora, beginning the practice of clerical marriage in Protestantism.
events.subtitle: Martin Luther
events.headline: Martin Luther marries Katharina von Bora, initiating clerical marriage in Protestantism

events.originalText: Henry Grace à Dieu, the largest warship ever built at the time, was launched from Woolwich Dockyard, England.
events.subtitle: Henry Grace à Dieu
events.headline: Henry Grace à Dieu launched from Woolwich Dockyard, England
